title: Chaman 2014 Cabernet Franc (Mendoza)
description: Roasted gritty berry and plum aromas suggest moderate ripeness. This feels drawing, tannic and in reverse, meaning it grows harder as it breathes. Dry, lightly salty blackberry and pepper flavors finish spicy, minty and oaky, alongside raw tannins.

title: Domaine d'Alzipratu 2015 Fiumeseccu Red (Corse Calvi)
description: With ripe black fruits and dense tannins, this wine is concentrated while also richly juicy. The structure and the blackberry fruits are ripe, balanced with acidity and a pepper and spice background. The wine will be ready from 2017.

title: Domaine des Cognettes 2014 Les 2 Terres Sur Lie  (Muscadet Sèvre et Maine)
description: A blend of vines grown on granite and richer gabbro soils, this is a full wine, with creamy white fruits and acidity that is fully integrated into the smooth texture. Crispness comes through at the end to give a bright aftertaste with plenty of acidity.

title: Valentín Bianchi 2014 Famiglia Bianchi Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendoza)
description: Roasted, gritty aromas of bacon and spicy oak are burnt on the surface. This is fleshy and full in body, with moderate acidity. Herbal, minty, lightly green berry flavors have a rooty accent and oaky makeup. Finishing flavors of mint and raw oak blend into herbal berry leftovers.

title: Buttonwood 2015 Zingy Sauvignon Blanc (Los Olivos District)
description: Green-apple skins and grapefruit rinds introduce the nose of this wine, followed by a bit of tropical papaya and melon. The palate show more apple skin and tangy lime as well as a tight minerality.

title: Airfield Estates 2013 Merlot (Yakima Valley)
description: Raspberry, oak, wood spice, vanilla and herb aromas are followed by plump, jammy red-fruit flavors that provide appeal.

title: Ammunition 2014 Pinot Noir (Sonoma County)
description: Sinewy texture and bright acidity meet a funk of blue cheese and forest in this interestingly complex and affordable wine. The earthiness continues in streaks of tart cranberry that ride along the palate.

title: Andis 2011 Petite Sirah (Sierra Foothills)
description: Full bodied, dark and tannic, this is a big wine with aromas and flavors of grilled herbs, black pepper, wood and earth. It feels broad on the palate, has a firm, fine-grained texture and lingering peppery flavors.

title: Archium 2014 Haven Grenache (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Aromas of cherry syrup, cola and cinnamon emerge from this bottling, which features artistic labels that always impress the eye. The palate shows dark red fruit and baking spice, as well as a minerality that combines rust and gravel.

title: Bouza 2013 B2 Parcela Unica Tannat (Canelones)
description: Ripe earthy aromas of raisin and oaky vanilla open this heavy, saturated Tannat that displays jagged tartaric acidity and heat (15.5% ABV). Stewed berry, raisin and vanilla flavors finish full, tannic and chunky. All in all, this seems a bit overdone and overripe.

title: Brian Carter Cellars 2015 Abracadabra Rosé (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Hot pink in color, this wine offer plentiful aromas of cherry and watermelon. It drinks off dry, with sugary sweet-fruit flavors that provide appeal.

title: Naggiar 2012 Estate Mourvèdre (Sierra Foothills)
description: Attractive oaky, well-aged aromas and flavors make this wine mellow and multi-faceted. It leads with cedar and cigar-box aromas, followed by touches of cherry and plum. The body is full, adding to the moderately tannic texture.

title: L. Tramier & Fils 2015 Collection  (Hautes Côtes de Nuits)
description: Produced from vineyards in the hills above the Côte de Nuits, this wine benefits from the ripe vintage of 2015. It has open red fruit and soft tannins that are both lifted by the acidity. Made to be drunk young, this is ready to enjoy now.

title: Napeequa 2015 Davey Outrageous Presents Pinkie a-go-go Rosé (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Pale peach in color, this wine offers bright notes of watermelon and cherry. It drinks a hair or two off dry, with plentiful juicy fruit flavors.

title: Rail2Rail 2014 Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)
description: Aromas like white pepper and dried herbs lead to ripe, direct fruit flavors and a feeling of power from the very full body.

title: One Woman 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (North Fork of Long Island)
description: Pristine grapefruit and gooseberry notes are offset by persistent layers of smoke, dusty mineral and earth in this Sauvignon Blanc. Full bodied on the palate yet vibrantly citrusy, it finishes brisk yet clean. Drink now through 2019.

title: Robert Mondavi 2014 Private Selection Aged in Bourbon Barrels Cabernet Sauvignon (Monterey County)
description: This wine gets a bonus for venturing into new territory, aging Cab in used Bourbon barrels. The result is far from perfect, but not as gimmicky as one might assume. Aromas of leathery blackberry, cedar, roasted pasilla chile and tons of caramel lead into flavors of cocoa, coconut and caramel on the creamy, peppery palate.
designation: Private Selection Aged in Bourbon Barrels

title: Roche de Bellene 2014 Cuvée Terroir  (Coteaux Bourguignons)
description: A blend of Gamay and Pinot Noir, this wine has qualities from both grapes. It has the bright cherry flavors of the Gamay and the rich, red-berry fruits of the Pinot Noir. They are finely integrated into this soft ripe wine that is ready to drink.

title: Tenute Costa 2015 Terre di Fiori  (Morellino di Scansano)
description: This opens with subdued aromas of red berry and violet. The lively, no-frills palate offers tart cherry and a hint of chopped herb accompanied by polished tannins. It's made to be enjoyed young so drink soon.

title: Tenute Fiorebelli 2011 Coste Bianche  (Amarone della Valpolicella)
description: This hearty red has aromas of scorched earth, dry forest floor, French oak and grilled herb. The robust palate shows the heat of the vintage, offering raisin, toasted oak, licorice and clove alongside dusty drying tannins and modest acidity.

title: San Lorenzo 2014  Rosso di Montalcino
description: Blue flower, red berry, forest floor and a whiff of Mediterranean herb lead the nose. The racy, linear palate delivers black cherry, pomegranate and clove framed in sleek tannins and bracing acidity. A note of powdered sage closes the finish.

title: Santa Rita 2015 Medalla Real Gran Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Leyda Valley)
description: Sharp, briny aromas of citrus and bell pepper teeter on vegetal. This is racy, pointed and minerally, with tangy, pyrazine-heavy flavors of lemon, white pepper and bell pepper. A snappy, piercing finish is lean and scouring.

title: Lone Birch 2015 Pinot Gris (Yakima Valley)
description: Generous, appealing melon, pear and apple aromas are followed by plump but still elegant while well-balanced fruit flavors. It's a bit one note but it hits that note well.

title: Maddalena 2015 Pinot Grigio (Monterey)
description: This bottling is easy, light and crisp, starting with squeezed orange and ripe yellow apples on the nose. It's delicate on the palate, with citrus and stone-fruit flavors, just right for an afternoon sip in the sun.

title: Madonna Nera 2014  Rosso di Montalcino
description: This opens with aromas suggesting French oak, dark berry, violet and coconut. The medium-bodied palate offers wild cherry, cranberry and oak-driven spice alongside bright acidity and close-grained, mouth-puckering tannins.

title: Querce Bettina 2013  Rosso di Montalcino
description: Fragrant purple flower, aromatic herb, wild berry and Asian spice aromas take center stage. The racy palate offers sour cherry, cranberry and sage accompanied by brisk acidity. Firm, close-grained tannins leave a drying finish.

title: François Millet 2015 Domaine des Côtes Blanches  (Sancerre)
description: Pure fruitiness holds the balance of this wine between crisp acidity and a tightly mineral texture. It comes from the producer's Bué vineyards, one of the top villages of Sancerre. The wine is crisp, made to be drunk young and fruity.

title: Giesen 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: This is delicately herbal, with green notes similar to snow peas gracing nectarine and grapefruit flavors. A bit of pineapple creeps in on the abbreviated finish.

title: El Enemigo 2015 Chardonnay (Mendoza)
description: This golden Chardonnay is loaded with rich, oaky aromas of corn pudding, butterscotch, baked apple and wood grain. Plump and soft on the palate, this tastes of baked apple, creamed corn and buttery oak, with popcorn to the finish. Drink through 2017.

title: Fournier Père et Fils 2015 Côtes de Morogues  (Menetou-Salon)
description: Deliciously light and herbal, this smooth, creamy wine is bright, poised with black-currant fruits and ripe gooseberry flavors. Drink this wine young, for its great fruit.
